snippet: Facebook, Twitter and YouTube have been required by government officials to hide some posts, under a law that critics say paves the way for broader censorship.
abstract: Russian communications regulators require Facebook, Twitter and YouTube to remove material they deem objectionable, exercising new law that gives them power to block Internet content that is illegal or harmful to children; Google, which owns YouTube, files suit to fight order.
lead_paragraph: Facebook, Twitter and YouTube have been required by government officials to hide some posts, under a law that critics say paves the way for broader censorship.

headline.seo: Russia Begins Selectively Blocking Internet Content
